bibl.title: A Long-lived 'Quick-birther' (okytokion).
bibl.note: On uterine amulets edited by: Campbell BONNER, Studies in Magical Amulets, chiefly Graeco-Egyptian = University of Michigan Studies. Humanistic Series. 49 (Ann Arbor, 1950) pp. 273-277, Nos 129-147. Suggests a new interpretation of ἐπὶ πόδια ("onto your little feet") on the reverse of No. 134 with evidence from the ancient medical writers. Emphasizes the longevity (Vth century B.C. - XVth century A.D.) of the okytokia amulets which summon the fetus forth.

bibl.title: Naissance et petite enfance dans l'Antiquité. Actes du colloque de Fribourg, 28 novembre - 1er décembre 2001

bibl.seg: Véronique DASEN (Éd.), Naissance et petite enfance dans l'Antiquité. Actes du colloque de Fribourg, 28 novembre - 1er décembre 2001 = Orbis Biblicus et Orientalis. 203 (Fribourg - Göttingen, 2004) pp. 265-280, 2 figg.

On uterine amulets edited by: Campbell BONNER, Studies in Magical Amulets, chiefly Graeco-Egyptian = University of Michigan Studies. Humanistic Series. 49 (Ann Arbor, 1950) pp. 273-277, Nos 129-147. Suggests a new interpretation of ἐπὶ πόδια ("onto your little feet") on the reverse of No. 134 with evidence from the ancient medical writers. Emphasizes the longevity (Vth century B.C. - XVth century A.D.) of the okytokia amulets which summon the fetus forth.
